title: Why are Lethality items still not melee only when ranged abused something they weren't supposed to?
body:
This Lethality change is just going to make ArmorPen abuse on ADCs retarded again.
ADCs were never ever supposed to be able to use flat armorpen, and were one of the MAIN reasons flat armorpen got changed into Lethality, gutting it altogether and ruining it for assassins too.

The other reason was flat armorpen was too snowbally, but there was MULTIPLE other ways to fix that issue. Soft cap of armorpen per level, hard cap overall, reducing flat armorpen on items, etc.

Every single AD assassin is melee. And changing flat armorpen to Lethality gutted their itemization.
Meanwhile the ranged ADCs that abused something they weren't even supposed to ever use could still use it (albeit Lethality being a lot worse overall and generally not worth).

And now you're just buffing Lethality and STILL not keeping it melee only?
This is stupid as fuck.

> [{quoted}](name=nep2une,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=g6vxkQ88,comment-id=00010000000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-01-12T15:29:14.869+0000)

I could have sworn that the main reason that armor pen got gutted was because it was too early game focused and it became a useless stat if the game dragged on too long which by that very nature made it more effective on ranged champions than it did on melee due to that early game focus of the stat. It wasn't because ranged champions weren't supposed to use it at all, but rather that they were the only champions it used to make complete sense on.
Riot specifically talked about ranged abusing it for a far stronger early game that they were never supposed to have.

> [{quoted}](name=nep2une,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=g6vxkQ88,comment-id=0001000000010000000000000000000000010000,timestamp=2017-01-12T15:59:08.566+0000)
>
> Riot specifically talked about ranged abusing it for a far stronger early game that they were never supposed to have.

This is true, they were not supposed to have that far stronger early game, the armor pen was okay though. That is why Lethality, the stat now replacing armor pen, has level scaling. It takes some of that power out of the early game and moves it to the mid and late game. This way ranged can still build it without being OP while doing so and the melee champions can still get some use out of it as well. It was never once intended to be only for Melee champions, ranged champions just used to abuse it better than melee could and Riot wanted them to be able to abuse it equally.

Burst isn't solely what defines an Assassin though, but also high mobility and single target selection. Jhin may be able to 100-0 a squishy with Lethality but he's not exactly mobile enough to zip in and out of the backline. This is why Riot classifies him as a Marksman/Burst Mage hybrid -- his combat patterns more accurately resemble that of those subclasses.

> [{quoted}](name=Chamuel85,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=g6vxkQ88,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-01-12T14:29:59.510+0000)
>

{{champion:202}} ? kek

{{champion:67}} and {{champion:29}} were classified as secondary "assassins" since like forever.

{{champion:18}} was also redubbed a "slayer" which equals to the old "assassin" tag.

We are comfortable with Marksmen buying Lethality items if that turns out to be optimal. As I said before we shipped it, neither killing nor preserving Marksman builds was a specific goal.

We did Lethality to make physical assassins more balanceable. It's not working out well for them at current tuning levels, so we're making changes. Marksmen aren't driving this stat's design.

I think part of the reason that people are concerned about this is because there is a question of whether you **can** balance Lethality for Physical Assassins without making Marksman as a *class* overtuned and thus in need of mass-changes.

There used to be a tradeoff between being able to kill champions and being able to take down towers (armor pen itemization vs full AD). Where is the decision making in the build if there is an optimal solution to highest DPS to both?
Were you guys less comfortable with them buying last season?
Why do melee top champions dominate the win rate charts if ranged top are so much better at everything?

Interesting to note that Kayle has the highest winrate in Top as of last patch (too early for this patch).   Quinn is 5 and Swain is 7. 

There's also the fact that while a ranged top laner (marksman anyway) can win lane, they are more likely to lose the game because they aren't providing a durable front liner for their team. 

Oh, and we have more melee champions going top anyway.

I would consider 3 out of the top 12 winrates to be anything BUT dominating. Only 4 of the top 20 are ranged. Sure, Kayle is just OP, but that doesn't mean range in general is. Sure, there are more melee champions, but that doesn't have anything to do with the fact that the ranged champs that do go top aren't at the top of winrates.

>There's also the fact that while a ranged top laner (marksman anyway) can win lane, they are more likely to lose the game because they aren't providing a durable front liner for their team.

This is the point I'm making. Yes, ranged champions will typically win lane. That's called an advantage. But this game isn't all about lane, which I think most people forget. What do you people want? To nerf ranged champions so that they can't win lane and are even worse afterwards? 

Tl;dr: there's more to League than laning.

Of course there is, but people tend to focus so much on the laning experience that they'll base their entire game off it. 

"I did bad in lane?  Guess it's an FF."

Which is exactly my point. People like OP are going to cry about melee champs losing lane, despite winning games and being better. So he wants melee champs to dominate lane and rekt even harder in teamfights. It makes no sense at all to me. Naut is going to bum fuck your team in a teamfight. So he wants Naut to also be solo killing everyone in lane? Where is the logic.

Personally I don't want Nautilus solo killing everyone in lane. I just prefer tanks like him actually having kill potential so they can win lane and prevent other champions from having an easy farm lane.

If they are so much better than ranged in teamfights, why do they also have to be good in lane?

What would be the point of ever picking a ranged champion top if they don't win lane and are worse in team fights?

Usually a ranged champion in top has a specific niche that helps them in teamfights or great at splitpushing. 

Quinn has crazy roaming potential. Jayce has great seige. Kennan is a teamfight monster. Swain has lots of sustain. Graves is played in the jungle. Kayle has a bunch of utility when behind (though it's mainly her ult) and her ranged capabilities make her great in splitpushing. 

Arguably the only one that sucks after lane is Teemo. But Teemo is interesting in that he's a very odd champion anyway. 

Unless you mean straight up taking a bot laner to top which is basically a cheese strategy. 

Ranged top laners should be a rare and risky decision in the first place.
Why should ranged top laners be rare lmfao?

Why should melee bot lane carries be practically nonexistent?

If you can make that or bruisers bot not only viable but a legitimate strategy in proplay, then you can have more common ranged top laners.

Well, I didn't say they should be. But, that's a 2v2 match up. Completely different. I don't see many people playing Sivir top lane, just like I don't see many people playing Jayce bot. That doesn't have much to do with just melee/ranged. The champs that go bot lane typically are extremely item reliant. So they go there to have a support get them to their status. That's why you don't see every ADC going top. Because they won't spike as quickly in a 1v1 lane, and melee champs will have an easier time hitting their spikes. The reason you don't see champs like Yi bot is because it's 2v2. The support can hard zone the champ off and not have to worry about losing cs for it. You have a dedicated zoner while the ADC can just farm away.

Ranged is going to have an advantage against melee in lane. Melee is typically going to have an advantage in team fights. Saying we should remove ranged's ability to beat melee champs in lane is fine if you're also suggesting we remove the tools melee champs have at beating ranged in teamfights. 

The fact that you think ranged champion shouldn't be allowed to play top is just nuts. So, do you only think melee should be mid as well? So Swain is forced bot as an APC?

Of course mid shouldn't be melee only. Mid is however I very unforgiving lane if you have so way to actually poke your targets pre six. Usually this poke is heavily ability based. 

I personally don't see how it's fair for ranged top laners to function in lane but we can't have melee bot lanes function well. This bothers me because many top laners were designed and balanced around top lane, and don't do as well outside of it. Normally they could jungle, but the jungle meta can shift widely and they soon could not keep up with meta junglers. 

And honestly what I find the worst about ranged top laners is how uninteractive it makes the lane. I go to farm and get poked by free resourceless harass. Whenever I try to punish, they peel me off because it seems every ranged top laner has self peel (except Urgot I guess). 

Yes, the game doesn't end at the laning phase, but that doesn't mean the laning phase should just be ignored. 

Allow melee carries to fight in botlane against marksmen and then I'll be more open to ranged in top lane.
Riot isn't going to make a bunch of items melee only to prevent abuse. It ruins build diversity.

And ironically, not making melee or ranged items also ruins build diversity by getting all the items nerfed or removed because rangeds abuse them.

>Every single AD assassin is melee.

I guess I don't see why lethality is inherently for melee champs in your arguement. I know armor pen items used to be typically built on melee only (Old Ghostblade for example) but the game evolves over time and that's just how it goes.

Flat armorpen is an early game snowball stat against squishes that gives more burst.
DPS are not allowed to have ridiculously high damage ranged burst in early against squishes.

Because that undermindes the design philosophy. 
High dps lategame champs being able to burst in the early-midgame is just plain wrong.
The main reason why flat arpen was replaced lethality is because it didn't scale well, and was way too powerful early game.  I don't think Riot had any intention to not let adc's use the stat.

Quinn is a ranged AD assassin, and Riot even acknowledges this (she's one of two marksmen classified by Riot as Marksman/Assassin, the other being Twitch).

Making it melee-only would hurt her ability to actually do her job (roam and assassinate), as the lethality items give her a more immediate powerspike and better roaming and burst potential than a standard ADC build.
Wouldn't be a tragic loss when quinn would be unplayable tbh until she receives a healthy kit.
